clothobserve.configs package¶

Submodules¶

clothobserve.configs.config module¶

clothobserve.configs.config¶

Configurations for different environments:
  • production
  • development
  • test

and initialization of Flask server.

copyright:© 2018 HashDivision OU.
license:Apache License 2.0, see LICENSE for more details.

class clothobserve.configs.config.Config¶

Bases: object

Base class for configuration. Most of configuration is customizable.

MAIL_DEFAULT_SENDER = 'Clothobserve <noreply@example.com>'¶

Default sender of mail.

MAIL_SERVER = '172.17.0.1'¶

SMTP server (example: Postfix) host (default - host from Docker perspective).

MAIL_SUPPRESS_SEND = True¶

Sending mail is suppressed by default.

MAIL_USE_TLS = True¶

Clothobserve server uses TLS to secure mail.

MONGODB_DB = 'clothobserve'¶

MongoDB database name (default - clothobserve), it should be already created.

MONGODB_HOST = 'mongodb'¶

MongoDB host (default - mongodb).

MONGODB_PASSWORD = 'clothobserveadmin'¶

MongoDB password for MONGODB_USERNAME user. Should be long and random in production.

MONGODB_PORT = 27017¶

MongoDB port (default - 27017, should be changed to random number in production).

MONGODB_USERNAME = 'clothobserveadmin'¶

MongoDB user with readWrite and dbAdmin privileges for clothobserve database (dbOwner privilege is bad for security).

REMEMBER_COOKIE_DURATION = 1209600¶

Session lifetime is set to 2 weeks, as it is the ideal duration.

SECRET_KEY = 'not-secret-enough-change-me-please'¶

Secret key should be at least 32 characters long and as random as possible.

SECURITY_DEPRECATED_HASHING_SCHEMES = []¶

Deprecated hashing schemes are empty, because we don’t use MD5 or SHA1 anyway.

SECURITY_HASHING_SCHEMES = ['pbkdf2_sha512']¶

Hashing schemes have only PBKDF2_SHA512 algorithm, since this is the only thing we use for password hashing.

SECURITY_PASSWORD_HASH = 'pbkdf2_sha512'¶

For secure passwords PBKDF2_SHA512 algorithm is used for hashing. It gives the best result on 64-bit server.

SECURITY_PASSWORD_SINGLE_HASH = True¶

Flask-Security unnecessary salts password twice, second time with salt from config.

SECURITY_TRACKABLE = True¶

We enable tracking of users logins, as this information can be useful for security.

SESSION_COOKIE_DOMAIN = '.example.com'¶

Session domain is written with dot to use session in subdomains.

SESSION_COOKIE_HTTPONLY = True¶

This flag tells browser that cookie cannot be retrieved via Javascript and should only be used in HTTP queries.

SESSION_COOKIE_SAMESITE = 'Strict'¶

This flag tells browser, that cookie cannot be used on other sites in requests to our site.

SESSION_COOKIE_SECURE = True¶

This flag tells browser to only send this cookie via HTTPS (should be used with HTTPS or browsers will ignore Set-Cookie header).

class clothobserve.configs.config.DevelopmentConfig¶

Bases: clothobserve.configs.config.Config

Base configuration for development.

DEBUG = True¶

Debug in Development environment turned on by default.

EXPLAIN_TEMPLATE_LOADING = True¶

Loading of templates is explained for better debugging.

TESTING = True¶

Testing in Development environment turned on by default.

class clothobserve.configs.config.DevelopmentLocalConfig¶

Bases: clothobserve.configs.config.DevelopmentConfig

Configuration for local development, which is used for testing features locally.

CONFIG_TYPE = 'development-local'¶

Config type is useful for debug purposes (to determine, what configuration is used).

MAIL_SUPPRESS_SEND = True¶

Sending mail is suppressed, because local development environment should not send mail.

SESSION_COOKIE_DOMAIN = '127.0.0.1'¶

Local development environment does not has domain name, so for cookies 127.0.0.1 is used.

SESSION_COOKIE_SECURE = False¶

Local development environment is not using HTTPS connection, so Secure flag is not set.

TRAP_BAD_REQUEST_ERRORS = True¶

Bad request errors are trapped for better debugging.

TRAP_HTTP_EXCEPTIONS = True¶

HTTP exceptions (errors) are trapped for better debugging.

class clothobserve.configs.config.DevelopmentServerConfig¶

Bases: clothobserve.configs.config.DevelopmentConfig

Configuration for development server.

CONFIG_TYPE = 'development-server'¶

Config type is useful for debug purposes (to determine, what configuration is used).

class clothobserve.configs.config.ProductionConfig¶

Bases: clothobserve.configs.config.Config

Production configuration class.

CONFIG_TYPE = 'production'¶

Config type is useful for debug purposes (to determine, what configuration is used).

DEBUG = False¶

Debug is turned off in production for security reasons.

TESTING = False¶

Testing is turned off in production for security reasons.

class clothobserve.configs.config.TestingConfig¶

Bases: clothobserve.configs.config.Config

Configuration for running tests (unittest & coverage).

CONFIG_TYPE = 'testing'¶

Config type is useful for debug purposes (to determine, what configuration is used).

DEBUG = True¶

In testing environment debug is turned on for better debugging.

EXPLAIN_TEMPLATE_LOADING = True¶

Loading of templates is explained for better debugging.

MAIL_SUPPRESS_SEND = True¶

Sending mail is suppressed, because testing environment should not send mail.

SESSION_COOKIE_DOMAIN = '127.0.0.1'¶

Testing environment does not has domain name, so for cookies 127.0.0.1 is used.

SESSION_COOKIE_SECURE = False¶

Local development environment is not using HTTPS connection, so Secure flag is not set.

TESTING = True¶

In testing environment testing is turned on for better debugging.

TRAP_BAD_REQUEST_ERRORS = True¶

Bad request errors are trapped for better debugging.

TRAP_HTTP_EXCEPTIONS = True¶

HTTP exceptions (errors) are trapped for better debugging.

clothobserve.configs.config.create_server() → flask.app.Flask¶

Creates and initializes Flask server.

Configuration is loaded from class (path to it should be in environment variable CONFIG_OBJECT), which should be subclassed from Config class. Configuration in HTTP proxy environment (ProxyFix) is done because original Clothobserve app is behind the proxy.

Returns:
The Flask class object.
